note.p: Education: Mr Barwick's School, Melton, Leicestershire; St John's College, Cambridge; BA (1659), MA (1662); MD (Oxford 1684)

Career: Travelled in France; corresponded with John Ray (FRS 1667); practised in York (1670-1683) and London (1684); accompanied the Earl of Portsmouth on his embassy to Paris (1698); Physician to the Queen (1703-1712); benefactor to the Asmolean Museum, Oxford
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Venn; Hunter; Foster
References: Robert W Unwin, 'A Provincial Man of Science at Work: Martin Lister, FRS, and his Illustrators 1670-1683' in NR 1995 vol 49 pp 209-230
David E Allen, 'Spider-Man at Work', review of John Parker and Basil Harley, eds, Martin Lister's English Spiders 1678 in NR 1993 vol 47 pp 144-145
Michael Hunter, 'The Social Bias and Changing Fortunes of an Early Scientific Institution: An Analysis of the Membership of the Royal Society, 1660-1685' in NR 1976-7 vol 31 pp 9-114
Marie Boas Hall, 'The Royal Society's Role in the Diffusion of Information in the Seventeenth Century' in NR 1974-5 vol 29 pp 173-192
P Fontes da Costa, 'The Culture of Curiosity at The Royal Society in the first half of the eighteenth century', NR 2002 vo l56 pp 147-166
Notes: Later possible birth date is from Hunter.
